subject: RE: [junit] What is a better way of feeding test data to a test case
msgSnippet: Hi Mithun, The general assumption is that modifying an XML to change the test case parameters is easier than changing the Java code. You can easily transform a
messageBody:
Hi Mithun,

The general assumption is that modifying an XML
to change the test case parameters is easier than
changing the Java code. You can easily transform

-----Original Message-----
From: mithun aiyanna [mailto:aiyannakn@...]
Sent: Saturday, July 03, 2004 7:19 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] What is a better way of feeding test data to a test
case


Hi All,
Could anyone give me suggestions as to which is a
better way of feeding test data to a test case? as of
now i have a TestData.java class where i set the
object to be passed into the test cae class with
values i want to test for. can i continue with this
method or would it be better to pass test data through
XMLs? it would be helpful if anyone could let me know
of any other method to feed test data as i feel both
these methods are a little crude as we have to do some
amount of hard coding...!!!

Regards,
Aiyanna.
